verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when Jabin king of Hazor had heard those things, that he sent to Jobab king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph,
verses.ct: When Jabin king of Hazor learned about all of this, he sent word to Jobab king of Madon, to the king of Shimron, to the king of Achshaph,

verses.kjv: And to the kings that were on the north of the mountains, and of the plains south of Chinneroth, and in the valley, and in the borders of Dor on the west,
verses.ct: to the kings in the northern hill country, in the plains south of Chinneroth, in the lowlands, and in the coastal region of Dor to the west,

verses.kjv: And to the Canaanite on the east and on the west, and to the Amorite, and the Hittite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite in the mountains, and to the Hivite under Hermon in the land of Mizpeh.
verses.ct: to the Canaanites on the east and west, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites in the hill country, and the Hivites below Mount Hermon in the region of Mizpeh.

verses.kjv: And they went out, they and all their hosts with them, much people, even as the sand that is upon the sea shore in multitude, with horses and chariots very many.
verses.ct: They marched out with all their armies — a massive force as countless as the sand on the seashore — along with a huge number of horses and chariots.

verses.kjv: And when all these kings were met together, they came and pitched together at the waters of Merom, to fight against Israel.
verses.ct: All these kings joined forces and set up camp together at the waters of Merom to wage war against Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Joshua, Be not afraid because of them: for to morrow about this time will I deliver them up all slain before Israel: thou shalt hough their horses, and burn their chariots with fire.
verses.ct: The LORD told Joshua, "Don't be afraid of them. By this time tomorrow, I will hand all of them over to Israel as dead men. You must cripple their horses and set their chariots on fire."

verses.kjv: So Joshua came, and all the people of war with him, against them by the waters of Merom suddenly; and they fell upon them.
verses.ct: So Joshua and his entire fighting force launched a surprise attack against them at the waters of Merom and charged at them.

verses.kjv: And the LORD delivered them into the hand of Israel, who smote them, and chased them unto great Zidon, and unto Misrephothmaim, and unto the valley of Mizpeh eastward; and they smote them, until they left them none remaining.
verses.ct: The LORD gave Israel victory over them. The Israelites struck them down and pursued them all the way to Greater Zidon, to Misrephothmaim, and to the valley of Mizpeh to the east. They kept striking them down until no survivors were left.

verses.kjv: And Joshua did unto them as the LORD bade him: he houghed their horses, and burnt their chariots with fire.
verses.ct: Joshua did exactly what the LORD had instructed him — he crippled their horses and burned their chariots.

verses.kjv: And Joshua at that time turned back, and took Hazor, and smote the king thereof with the sword: for Hazor beforetime was the head of all those kingdoms.
verses.ct: Then Joshua turned back and captured Hazor, killing its king with the sword. Hazor had previously been the leading city among all those kingdoms.

verses.kjv: And they smote all the souls that were therein with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying them: there was not any left to breathe: and he burnt Hazor with fire.
verses.ct: They killed every person in the city with the sword, completely destroying them. Not a single living thing remained. Then he burned Hazor to the ground.

verses.kjv: And all the cities of those kings, and all the kings of them, did Joshua take, and smote them with the edge of the sword, and he utterly destroyed them, as Moses the servant of the LORD commanded.
verses.ct: Joshua captured all the cities of those kings and killed all the kings themselves with the sword, completely destroying them, just as Moses the servant of the LORD had commanded.

verses.kjv: But as for the cities that stood still in their strength, Israel burned none of them, save Hazor only; that did Joshua burn.
verses.ct: However, Israel did not burn any of the cities built on their mounds — except for Hazor, which Joshua burned.

verses.kjv: And all the spoil of these cities, and the cattle, the children of Israel took for a prey unto themselves; but every man they smote with the edge of the sword, until they had destroyed them, neither left they any to breathe.
verses.ct: The Israelites kept all the plunder and livestock from these cities for themselves, but they killed every person with the sword until they had wiped them out completely. They did not leave anyone alive.

verses.kjv: As the LORD commanded Moses his servant, so did Moses command Joshua, and so did Joshua; he left nothing undone of all that the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: What the LORD had commanded his servant Moses, Moses passed on to Joshua, and Joshua carried it out. He left nothing undone from everything the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: So Joshua took all that land, the hills, and all the south country, and all the land of Goshen, and the valley, and the plain, and the mountain of Israel, and the valley of the same;
verses.ct: So Joshua conquered that entire region — the hill country, the whole southern territory, the entire land of Goshen, the western foothills, the Jordan Valley, and the mountains and lowlands of Israel.

verses.kjv: Even from the mount Halak, that goeth up to Seir, even unto Baalgad in the valley of Lebanon under mount Hermon: and all their kings he took, and smote them, and slew them.
verses.ct: From Mount Halak, which rises toward Seir, all the way to Baalgad in the valley of Lebanon below Mount Hermon — he captured all their kings, struck them down, and killed them.

verses.kjv: Joshua made war a long time with all those kings.
verses.ct: Joshua waged war against all these kings for a long time.

verses.kjv: There was not a city that made peace with the children of Israel, save the Hivites the inhabitants of Gibeon: all other they took in battle.
verses.ct: Not a single city made a peace agreement with the Israelites except the Hivites living in Gibeon. Every other city was taken by force.

verses.kjv: For it was of the LORD to harden their hearts, that they should come against Israel in battle, that he might destroy them utterly, and that they might have no favour, but that he might destroy them, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.ct: It was the LORD's doing that their hearts were hardened to fight against Israel, so that he would completely destroy them without mercy, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.

verses.kjv: And at that time came Joshua, and cut off the Anakims from the mountains, from Hebron, from Debir, from Anab, and from all the mountains of Judah, and from all the mountains of Israel: Joshua destroyed them utterly with their cities.
verses.ct: During that time, Joshua went and wiped out the Anakites from the hill country — from Hebron, Debir, Anab, and from all the hill country of Judah and all the hill country of Israel. Joshua completely destroyed them along with their cities.

verses.kjv: There was none of the Anakims left in the land of the children of Israel: only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, there remained.
verses.ct: No Anakites remained in the land of Israel. The only ones left were in Gaza, Gath, and Ashdod.

verses.kjv: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that the LORD said unto Moses; and Joshua gave it for an inheritance unto Israel according to their divisions by their tribes. And the land rested from war.
verses.ct: So Joshua took control of the entire land, exactly as the LORD had promised Moses. Joshua then distributed it as an inheritance to Israel, dividing it among their tribes. And the land had rest from war.
